meanings.definition: Make (something) appear less important or significant.
meanings.sent1: She tried to downplay her mistake in front of her boss.
meanings.sent2: It is not good to downplay the importance of safety precautions.
meanings.sent3: He always downplays his achievements, but we know he works hard.
meanings.sent4: The politician's attempt to downplay the scandal only made it worse.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used humor to downplay the difficulty of the math problem.

meanings.definition: Understate the importance or significance of.
meanings.sent1: The company tends to downplay the impact of their products on the environment.
meanings.sent2: It is common for people to downplay their own talents.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly downplayed the size of the fish she caught.
meanings.sent4: The artist's use of color downplays the intensity of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The coach's speech tried to downplay the pressure on the team to win.
